name: Create Tables and Populate
func:
msg.topic = `
CREATE TABLE Users (
    user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE
);

CREATE TABLE Restaurants (
    restaurant_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    website VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE Reviews (
    review_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    restaurant_id INT REFERENCES Restaurants(restaurant_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    user_id INT REFERENCES Users(user_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    rating INT CHECK (rating >= 1 AND rating <= 5),
    comment TEXT,
    review_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

INSERT INTO Users (username, email) VALUES
('JohnDoe', 'john@example.com'),
('JaneDoe', 'jane@example.com'),
('MikeSmith', 'mike@example.com'),
('SarahLee', 'sarah@example.com');

INSERT INTO Restaurants (name, address, phone_number, website) VALUES
('Pasta Palace', '1234 Elm St, Springfield, IL', '555-1234', 'http://pastapalace.com'),
('Burger Barn', '5678 Oak St, Springfield, IL', '555-5678', 'http://burgerbarn.com'),
('Taco Town', '9101 Maple St, Springfield, IL', '555-9101', 'http://tacotown.com'),
('Sushi Central', '1213 Pine St, Springfield, IL', '555-1213', 'http://sushicentral.com'),
('Pizza Planet', '1415 Cedar St, Springfield, IL', '555-1415', 'http://pizzaplanet.com');

INSERT INTO Reviews (restaurant_id, user_id, rating, comment) VALUES
(1, 1, 5, 'Amazing pasta, will definitely come back!'),
(1, 2, 4, 'Good food, but service could be better.'),
(1, 3, 3, 'Average experience, nothing special.'),
(1, 4, 4, 'Loved the ambiance, pasta was great!'),

(2, 1, 5, 'Best burgers in town!'),
(2, 2, 4, 'Great taste, slightly overpriced.'),
(2, 3, 4, 'Very good, but could use more options.'),
(2, 4, 3, 'Decent food, but not worth the hype.'),

(3, 1, 5, 'Delicious tacos, highly recommend!'),
(3, 2, 4, 'Tasty, but the portions are small.'),
(3, 3, 2, 'Disappointing, expected better.'),
(3, 4, 4, 'Great flavors, will come again.'),

(4, 1, 5, 'Best sushi I have ever had!'),
(4, 2, 4, 'Very good sushi, a bit pricey.'),
(4, 3, 3, 'Average sushi, expected more.'),
(4, 4, 4, 'Good quality, but service was slow.'),

(5, 1, 5, 'Amazing pizza, just like in Italy!'),
(5, 2, 5, 'Loved the crust, will order again.'),
(5, 3, 4, 'Great pizza, but long wait time.'),
(5, 4, 4, 'Good pizza, but a bit greasy.');

`
return msg;

name: Select Restaurants and Ratings
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, 
       AVG(rv.rating) AS average_rating
FROM Restaurants r
JOIN Reviews rv ON r.restaurant_id = rv.restaurant_id
GROUP BY r.name
ORDER BY average_rating DESC;

`
return msg;

name: All Reviews One Restaurant
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT u.username, rv.rating, rv.comment, rv.review_date
FROM Reviews rv
JOIN Users u ON rv.user_id = u.user_id
JOIN Restaurants r ON rv.restaurant_id = r.restaurant_id
WHERE r.name = 'Pasta Palace'
ORDER BY rv.review_date DESC;

`
return msg;

name: Top 3
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, 
       AVG(rv.rating) AS average_rating
FROM Restaurants r
JOIN Reviews rv ON r.restaurant_id = rv.restaurant_id
GROUP BY r.name
ORDER BY average_rating DESC
LIMIT 3;

`
return msg;

name: One Reviewer
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, rv.rating, rv.comment, rv.review_date
FROM Reviews rv
JOIN Restaurants r ON rv.restaurant_id = r.restaurant_id
JOIN Users u ON rv.user_id = u.user_id
WHERE u.username = 'JohnDoe'
ORDER BY rv.review_date DESC;

`
return msg;

name: Reviews per Restaurant
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, 
       COUNT(rv.review_id) AS review_count
FROM Restaurants r
JOIN Reviews rv ON r.restaurant_id = rv.restaurant_id
GROUP BY r.name
ORDER BY review_count DESC;

`
return msg;

name: No Reviews for Restaurant
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name
FROM Restaurants r
LEFT JOIN Reviews rv ON r.restaurant_id = rv.restaurant_id
WHERE rv.review_id IS NULL;

`
return msg;

name: Latest Reviews per Restaurant
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, 
       u.username, 
       rv.rating, 
       rv.comment, 
       rv.review_date
FROM Reviews rv
JOIN Users u ON rv.user_id = u.user_id
JOIN Restaurants r ON rv.restaurant_id = r.restaurant_id
WHERE (r.restaurant_id, rv.review_date) IN (
    SELECT restaurant_id, MAX(review_date)
    FROM Reviews
    GROUP BY restaurant_id
)
ORDER BY rv.review_date DESC;

`
return msg;

name: Five Star Reviewers
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT DISTINCT u.username
FROM Reviews rv
JOIN Users u ON rv.user_id = u.user_id
WHERE rv.rating = 5;

`
return msg;

name: Average Rating by Reviewer
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT u.username, 
       AVG(rv.rating) AS average_rating
FROM Reviews rv
JOIN Users u ON rv.user_id = u.user_id
GROUP BY u.username
ORDER BY average_rating DESC;

`
return msg;

name: Low Rated Restaurants
func:
msg.topic = `
SELECT r.name AS restaurant_name, 
       AVG(rv.rating) AS average_rating
FROM Restaurants r
JOIN Reviews rv ON r.restaurant_id = rv.restaurant_id
GROUP BY r.name
HAVING AVG(rv.rating) < 3
ORDER BY average_rating ASC;

`
return msg;
